page.title: 16Mountnessing Windmill
page.content: Mountnessing Windmill is a postmill which dates from 1807.It is built on a mound and we were told this probably means that an earlier mill which stood here was also a postmill.In the last few years over 50 windmills have been lost within a radius of 15 miles.Our windmill has been preserved by local effort.In 1956 it was sold to Essex County Council for one shilling and is now a grade 2 building. It is surprising that it is still standing because when it was a home guard post people thought it helped German pilots to navigate and threatened to demolish it.Later it became too expensive to keep and the money it was said could be better used to build a bus shelter. It was also damaged by lightning.By the summer of 1983 restoration was finally completed ,the mill was opened and now grinds corn on open days.
